reviewText: *Un Bias Review 2.0!* Ok First off I would like to say I am sorry for my first review it was mostly because I was in a bad mood after buying the game. There are a few things that I missed on my first playthrough. 1 There is a settings menu, which is great! unfortuatly messing around with the resolution a bit broke the game, my second screen, and my steam, Some how it inverted the colors and filled the screen with dots. Even then the menu screens still were in the wrong resolution and had big black bars at the top and bottom of the screen, In game it fit the screen fine. The second problem I ran into was to do with the physics, I had alot of very bad clipping problems with a few of them resulting in my loader or what ever I was picking up flying into the wall. The third problem was that nothing had any weight or feel to it, it felt as if I was driving a hover loader picking up things with a anti gravity device or something, because they all just slid around on the floor. The fourth thing was the default music was way too loud. While looking in the settings tab I found you could import your own music *HOLY ♥♥♥♥* More games need to do that! I can see they were aiming for a realistic feel to the game but it was a bit off. When you are in the first person view you can't see very much so I use the free cam, the only problem with the free cam is most of the sounds are missing when you go into free cam *Engine sounds, Debris hitting the floor ect* The physics just freeze sometimes, the game is still running *rain falling and such* but the loader doesnt move at all. The game runs pretty choppy with fps drops about every 50 seconds. I will list my full pc specs aswell *16GB of RipJaw Z series ddr3 ram, Msi 970A G46, Amd fx 8350 Black Edition running at 4.0Ghz, Radeon 7870 Ghz Editio (Yes I know its bottlenecking right now I am saving up for another one but money is tight right now) and a 750W power suply* There we go I hope this review is less Bias :)

reviewText:
Controls cannot be reconfigured.
Machinery has self-centering steering even when stationary which makes it almost impossible to drive.
Machinery has no suspension and the 4WD works intermittently making your machine remain stationary with wheel spin and then launch forward.
I gave up in the 2nd mission when you're meant to pickup bricks but the bricks magically bounce back out of your loader bucket when you stop.
voteText: 27 of 29 people (93%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Well I have played 4 hours of it upon writing this review. I am not quite sure where the complaints are coming from but here is my personal experience. Brace yourself it is not exactly short. This will more be a review for people who want a bit more detail of the game instead of just a it sucks" type of review.

Camera:
Press C and get into outside view
date:
use left mouse button and can move camera any angle you like.
I could post the suggestion to maybe in the future put more camera control in all the views.


Graphics:
I have not seen an issue there either
recommended: when launching game it gives you options to change settings and so far am getting basically what I see in the trailer. If you experience lag
hoursPlayed: just lower your settings. It has its bumps and jolts here and there but nothing to make it unplayable for me.\n\n(Will also add I am not sure how peoples CPUs and GPUs are overheating
voteText:
Mine are all within normal temperature while running this game)

Gameplay:
Challenging at times. But I enjoy a challenge. The game will require you to take your time and go slow at times
helpfulPercent: you are not a racecar driver. But if you do you can complete your challenges
votesHelpful:
I have been able to complete all them first try so far.

You can flip your vehicles over so be careful. To me this just gets you to be careful while playing and adds to the challenge.

Yes some things will bounce around
votesTotal: but I only seemed to have that problem if I went at it like a bat out of hell. It just convinced me to take my time doing it which honestly allowed me to enjoy the game more.\n\nI find it to be a decent simulation
votesFunny: you are doing just as it describes. If the game made it too easy on you and were able to rush whole thing would not be any playablitity.\n\nThis game I think is suitable for people into this genre of games
commentsCount:
you must be willing to accept this genre before enjoying it. It will not be for everyone.

Tips
As for anyone having crashes or not starting here is some things I personally found that helped if I ever get an error.
1) Do windows updates
2)Restart computer
3) Launch settings instead of game
column16: click save and play. I have had this fix errors even if I didn't change the settings
column17:
is this gamebreaking? Not really as it is a 2 second solution. (If this is your problem. Not saying it will solve everyones but solved mine.)

Conclusion:
Is the game perfect? No
column18: I am not saying it is
column19: it has its flaws but what game doesn't?\nThe developer has also been quite active with the community to take in feedback which is a plus. Just give him your feedback if you see something
column20: at least this game has an active one.\n\nAs for the price range
column22: it is not like it is a $40-$60 AAA simulator game. I think the price range for this and how the game plays out is quite worth it for that range for people interested in the genre.\n\nIf I encouter any game breaking problems I will post it as well but so far my game is still running fine with the exception of the couple things I mentioned

reviewText:
8 out of 42 players like this game.

Graphics are okay assuming you have high end SLI'd GPU's.

Controls aren't good enough to be considered, ARCADE;  this game should not even be under the category of simulation.

40 pound rocks can make the Bulldozer flip over; no exaggeration.

No speed range.  There are only 2 speeds: Fast and Out of Control.

Running over 40 pound rocks can cause you to loose what you just scooped up from the ground; no physics at all.


I am seriously thinking about reporting this game to the Better Business Bureau; it should be banned from America.

reviewText:
Wouldn't recommend this game.  The only settings available to change from the UI are sound, graphical quality, vsync and soft-shadows.  It hard locks the resolution @ 640x480 which on a 1080p monitor looks horrible.  In addition the vehicles are way to touchy and no where near realistic.

A bit on the vehicles, they move too fast.  When trying to do something that requires percision, that is not an ability.  Most controls are centered to the left side of the keyboard.  WSAD for movement, RF,TG for bucket controls,  It just feels un-natural.  You should be able to select your speed when operating the machine.  In addition to the machines running way to fast, they bounce all over the place.  Or when you pick up an item in your bucket it bounces right out of said bucket.  It makes it hard to finish any of the missions.

I'd rate it a 2 out of 10.  And that is only for the concept of the game.  If it was better implemented it would be a better game overall.  I would recommend passing on this game.

reviewText:
Dont buy. There are soo many things that is not right, and i have a -really- low standard for odd games. (For example i own most of the german indie titles for construction, building, towing, transporting etc).

Graphics: Not all to chabby, but stutters even on low settings.
Physics: Let's not go there at all.
Camera: Well, uhm, it's just bad.
Gameplay: You cant move the camera *and* drive at the same time. As soon as you move the camera, your veichle stops.
There is problems scooping up stuff in general with loader and buckets. Debris just bounce around and out.

Soo, in conclusion, save your money. I bought it as i can tolerate most odd games, even bad ones. This is just worse.

/Rikard

reviewText:
Playway great developers they try hard and then they try even harder despite what people think they stick to it and keep going forwards.

Well i have a soft spot for most sim games this game is a bunch of fun im enjoying it and every one is entitled to there own opinion and you will always have negative people but i just tune them out.

The game play is great alot to do if you want to do it right the graphics are good with every thing set to max under launch option not shore how people are over heating but with everything set to max CPU runs at 37c and GPU runs at 42c

The textures could use little touching up some are little fuzzy not shore if its he type of texture used or the way they are rendered or just me playing with options

Controls can be a little frustrating at times they can be rather sensitive but if you take your time and be gentle you can overcome this

The game has good game-play with contracts mode free-play mode and challenge mode they are all fun nice range of vehicles but i believe shared vehicle psychics is the only down side but considering the price i can live with that

Best of all the developers are active taking suggestions and then fixing the game which seems to be the playway way of doing things which is great and for small price of $14.99 its great value for money

reviewText:
Poor physics makes the game impossible to play, especially when not using an analog controller.
I truly regret spending 12 EURO on this game..... :-(

Joints on the machines act like theyve been attached with rubber bands, like when u put stress on them, theyll actually come apart and get drawn back together by an invisible force.

The game seems to combine the worst of reality and arcade into a big mess, which boils down to a truly crappy game.

Even older construction sims are way better than this one, its so disappointing and thats prolly why theres no trial download either, because they know that no one would buy it once theyve tried it.

I pretty much feel scammed by buying this game, all i can hope for is, that the mnoney I and others spent here, will go into supporting development of a descent new version of this game...

reviewText:
In short, a polished turd. The control system is horrible, with touchy WASD control and no option to use controller input. Combine that with an awful camera system which doesn't even let you pan or zoom - pretty frustrating as the camera is always in an inconvenient location. Even Demolition Company allows these basic things.

Despite its appearance, this game does no better job handling physics than other similar titles. Bulldozers bounce around the map and drive like go karts.

I think the developers spent more time on the glossy UI than they did on the core of the game.

reviewText: When I purchased Construction Machines 2014, I tried my best to ignore the mostly negative reviews in hopes that it would be a really cool game I could enjoy. I've gotta say I should have listened to the reviews. I love the premise of the game: you're a construction business owner and you have to perform contracts" (in which each contract is a small task like moving rocks or picking up bricks) to earn more money
date: buy new machines to have fun with and ultimately expand your business. The prospect of the new tasks are fun
recommended: but once it comes time to actually do them it just leaves you disappointed and actually frusturated.\n\nThe controls are very sensitive yet completely unresponsive at the same time. For example
hoursPlayed: if you're attemting to gently manuever the front end loader around a rock so you don't hit it
voteText: just tapping the turning keys lightly doesn't turn the vehicle at all. However if you hold the key in for a slight second longer it turns the vehicle almost all of the way. One would believe performing pinpoint manuevers is a necessity in a cluttered construction yard but this game won't allow for it. Oh
helpfulPercent: it's worth mentioning if you actually DO run over the rock or obstacles you were trying to avoid
votesHelpful: the physics are so bad that the whole truck behaves like a stiff piece wood with no shock absorbers at all and it just looks pathetic rigidly shaking around over what you just hit. reviewText:
Having walked past a construction site once when I was a kid, I can say that this is one of the poorest representations of a butterfly simulator.
Graphics are low grade and fuzzy, settings are limited, Hitboxes etc are poorly laid out. Cameras however are not laid out at all. Switching between views has added more functionality to pong than it has to this.

Can I has a refund?

reviewText:
I would like to recommend this game - equipment simulators are often sincere, dedicated to their simple premise, and deliver on a lowball promise to replicate the experience of using these machines.  It's not flashy, or dramatic, but much like model railways, there's an enduring interest in simulation.

Certainly, all the stuff you expect is in this game - a variety of machines, even a first person view as you run around your machine, check it out, and jump in your vehicle, steer, drive, operate the bucket with simulated levers.   Doing jobs earns you money, which you spend to buy better equipment, so it has a nice progression/career system.

In the case of this game, however - the technical settings let everything down.  No support for 4K means the game is now effectively dead for all machines of the future.  I'll be happy to review my review if they ever fix it, but until then, gaming moves on, and the developers have chosen, through inaction, to let Construction Machines 2014 stay behind.

reviewText: When I purchased Construction Machines 2014, I tried my best to ignore the mostly negative reviews in hopes that it would be a really cool game I could enjoy. I've gotta say I should have listened to the reviews. I love the premise of the game: you're a construction business owner and you have to perform contracts" (in which each contract is a small task like moving rocks or picking up bricks) to earn more money
date: buy new machines to have fun with and ultimately expand your business. The prospect of the new tasks are fun
recommended: but once it comes time to actually do them it just leaves you disappointed and actually frusturated.\n\nThe controls are very sensitive yet completely unresponsive at the same time. For example
hoursPlayed: if you're attemting to gently manuever the front end loader around a rock so you don't hit it
voteText: just tapping the turning keys lightly doesn't turn the vehicle at all. However if you hold the key in for a slight second longer it turns the vehicle almost all of the way. One would believe performing pinpoint manuevers is a necessity in a cluttered construction yard but this game won't allow for it. Oh
helpfulPercent: it's worth mentioning if you actually DO run over the rock or obstacles you were trying to avoid
votesHelpful: the physics are so bad that the whole truck behaves like a stiff piece wood with no shock absorbers at all and it just looks pathetic rigidly shaking around over what you just hit. The engines sound like a lawn tractor and they don't change noises based on your engine RPM's or activity
votesTotal: it just sounds like it's a constant idle. The music is so bad and repetitive I actually just shut it off completely and listened to the constantly-idling engine which then became annoying in itself. The graphics on the "high" setting also resemble that of a bad Nintendo 64 game but the camera angles are so frusturating to deal with so you barely get to see any of the poor graphics anyway!\n\nAll in all it was a supurb idea that was poorly delivered in every way shape or form. I give it a 2 out of 5 for the excellent concept but totally poor construction (pun intended.) Save your hard-earned money and purchase something else gamers!"
